div.l: For in oure wille ther stikith eủere a naile
To haue an hore hede and a grene taile
As hath leke for though oure myght be gon
Oure wille desirith folie euer in oon
Fo whanne we may nat don thanne wille we speke
Yit in oure asshen olde is fire I reke
Foure gledis han we which I will deuyse
Avauntyng lyinge anger couetise
Thise foure sperkelis longeth to elde
Oure olde lymmes may wel be vnweldy
Bulte ButtBulteButt wille schal nat failen that is soth
And yit haue I al wey a coltes toth
As many yere as hit is passid henne
Synne that my tap̄pe of lif by gan for renne
For sikirly whanne I was bore anon
Deth drowe the tappe of lif and lete hit gon
And eủer sith forsoth hath the tappe I ronne
Till that almost al empti is the Tonne
The strem of lif now droppith vp on the chymbe
The sely tounge may well rynge and chymbe
Of wrechednesse that passid is ful ȝore
With olde folke saue dotage is ther namore
Whenne that oure Oste hadde herde this sermonyng
He ganne to speke as lordly as hit were a kynge
He seide what amountith al this witt
What schal we speke al day of holy writt
The deuyl made a Reue us for to preche
And of a sowter Schipman othir aleche
Sey forth thi tale and tary nat the tyme
Lo Depford is her and hit is halfwey prime
Lo also Grenewiche that many a schrew is Inne
Hit were al tyme thi tale to by gynne
¶ Now certis quoth tho this oswolde the reue
I pray you all that ye nat you greue
Though I answer and somdell sette his howue
For leful is with fors force of schowue
This dronke myller hath told vs here
How that bili bili bigilid was a Carpynt̉er
Par auenture in scorne for I am on
And by your leue schal hym quite anon
